parties.raw_snippet:
This is to confirm that, in consideration of the agreements hereinafter contained, the undersigned, the Integrity Short Term
Government Fund, (the “Fund”), an open-end, diversified, management investment company organized as a series of The Integrity
Funds, a Delaware statutory trust, has agreed that Integrity Funds Distributor, LLC, (“Integrity”), shall be, for the period of this
distribution agreement (the “Agreement”), the principal underwriter of shares issued by the Fund, including such classes of shares
as may now or hereafter be authorized (the “Shares”).
parties.reasoning: The opening paragraph explicitly names the contracting parties: the Integrity Short Term Government Fund (the Fund) and Integrity Funds Distributor, LLC (Integrity). These are the primary parties who agree the Fund appoints Integrity as principal underwriter.

contract_type.raw_snippet:
DISTRIBUTION AND SERVICES AGREEMENT

Section 1.1 Integrity will act as principal underwriter for the distribution of the Shares covered by the registration statement, prospectus, and statement of additional information then in effect of the Fund (the “Registration Statement”) under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the “1933 Act”), and the Investment Company Act of 1940, as amended (the “1940 Act”).
contract_type.reasoning: The title and Section 1.1 show the core economic substance: Integrity's role is to act as principal underwriter/distributor of the Fund's shares and to perform distribution-related services. This is primarily a distribution (underwriting) arrangement rather than, for example, a pure services or licensing agreement.

notice_period.reasoning: Section 7.1 provides that continuance after the initial term "shall continue automatically for successive annual periods... provided such continuance is specifically approved at least annually by (a) the Fund’s Board of Trustees and (b) a vote of a majority ... of the Fund’s Trustees who are not interested persons (the 'Qualified Trustees')." Because renewal depends on specific annual approvals rather than a notice-to-prevent-auto-renewal mechanism, there is no discrete "notice period to prevent automatic renewal" to extract.

expiration_date.raw_snippet:
Section 7.1 This Agreement shall continue until January 18, 2022, and thereafter shall continue automatically for successive annual
periods ending on January 18th of each year, provided such continuance is specifically approved at least annually by (a) the Fund’s
Board of Trustees and (b) a vote of a majority (as defined in the 1940 Act) of the Fund’s Trustees who are not interested persons
(as defined in the 1940 Act) of the Fund and who have no direct or indirect financial interest in the operation of the Plan, in this
Agreement, or any agreement related to the Plan (the “Qualified Trustees”), by vote cast in person at a meeting called for the
purpose of voting on such approval.
expiration_date.reasoning: Section 7.1 explicitly states the initial term end date: "shall continue until January 18, 2022," which is a calendar date and thus convertible to ISO format.

renewal_term.raw_snippet: and thereafter shall continue automatically for successive annual periods ending on January 18th of each year, provided such continuance is specifically approved at least annually by (a) the Fund’s Board of Trustees and (b) a vote of a majority (as defined in the 1940 Act) of the Fund’s Trustees who are not interested persons (as defined in the 1940 Act) of the Fund and who have no direct or indirect financial interest in the operation of the Plan, in this Agreement, or any agreement related to the Plan (the “Qualified Trustees”), by vote cast in person at a meeting called for the purpose of voting on such approval.
renewal_term.reasoning: This clause describes the renewal mechanism: automatic continuation in successive annual periods (ending January 18 each year) but conditioned on specific annual approval by the Fund’s Board and the Qualified Trustees. The renewal period is therefore one year, subject to the stated approval condition.
renewal_term.normalized_value: 1 year auto-renewal (successive annual periods ending Jan 18; subject to annual approval by Fund's Board and Qualified Trustees)
